+ # WhatsApp2PDF
  
- Convert your WhatsApp chat exports to **beautiful, printable PDFs** with complete privacy. All processing happens **100% client-side** â€” your private conversations never leave your device.
- 
- ![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-green)

+ Convert WhatsApp chat exports to PDF. All processing happens client-sideâ€”your data never leaves your device.
  
- ## âœ¨ Features
+ ## Features
  
- - **ğŸ”’ Privacy First**: All processing happens in your browser. No server uploads, no tracking, no data collection.
- - **ğŸ“„ Print-Optimized PDFs**: Compact layout designed for efficient printing with maximum messages per page.
- - **ğŸ“± WhatsApp-Style Preview**: View your chats in a familiar interface before exporting.
- - **ğŸŒ HTML Export**: Create standalone HTML files as an alternative.
- - **ğŸ–¼ï¸ Media Support**: Includes images, PDFs, and other attachments in exports.
- - **ğŸ‘¤ POV Selection**: Choose whose perspective to view (your messages on right side).
- - **ğŸŒ™ Dark/Light Mode**: Automatic theme detection with manual toggle.
- - **ğŸ” Search &amp; Filter**: Find messages instantly with full-text search and date filtering.
- - **âš¡ Works Offline**: Once loaded, works entirely offline.
-

- ## ğŸ“¤ How to Export from WhatsApp
- 
- ### On iPhone/iOS:
- 1. Open the chat you want to export
- 2. Tap the contact/group name at the top
- 3. Scroll down and tap **Export Chat**
- 4. Choose **Attach Media** (for images) or **Without Media** (text only)
- 5. Save the .zip file
- 
- ### On Android:
- 1. Open the chat you want to export
- 2. Tap **â‹®** (menu) â†’ **More** â†’ **Export chat**
- 3. Choose **Include Media** or **Without Media**
- 4. Save the .zip file
- 
- ### Supported Formats:
- - &#96;.zip&#96; files (recommended â€” includes media)
- - &#96;_chat.txt&#96; files (text only)
- - Multiple files (drag &amp; drop the folder contents)
+ ## Export from WhatsApp
+ 
+ **iOS**: Chat â†’ Contact name â†’ Export Chat â†’ Attach media / Without media
+ 
+ **Android**: Chat â†’ Menu (â‹®) â†’ More â†’ Export chat â†’ Include Media / Without Media
+ 
+ **Supported formats**: &#96;.zip&#96; files (with media) or &#96;_chat.txt&#96; files (text only)
  
- ## ğŸ“„ PDF Features
+ ## PDF Features
  
- - **Cover Page**: Chat statistics, participant list, and document disclaimer
- - **Compact Messages**: Optimized spacing for efficient printing
- - **POV Indicator**: Shows whose perspective the chat is viewed from
- - **Attachment Previews**: Optional image thumbnails in chat bubbles
- - **Image Gallery**: Full-size images at the end (optional)
- - **PDF Document Embedding**: Renders PDF attachments as images
-

- â”œâ”€â”€ styles.css      # All styles (dark theme homepage, chat UI)
- â”œâ”€â”€ parser.js       # WhatsApp chat format parser
- â”œâ”€â”€ renderer.js     # Chat UI renderer
- â”œâ”€â”€ exporter.js     # PDF &amp; HTML export functionality
- â”œâ”€â”€ app.js          # Main application logic
- â””â”€â”€ README.md       # This file
+ â”œâ”€â”€ index.html      # Main HTML
+ â”œâ”€â”€ styles.css      # Styles
+ â”œâ”€â”€ parser.js       # Chat parser
+ â”œâ”€â”€ renderer.js     # UI renderer
+ â”œâ”€â”€ exporter.js     # PDF/HTML export
+ â””â”€â”€ app.js          # Main logic
  &#96;&#96;&#96;
  
- ## ğŸ”§ Technical Details
+ ## Technical Details
  
- ### Dependencies (loaded from CDN)
- - [JSZip](https://stuk.github.io/jszip/) â€” ZIP file extraction
- - [jsPDF](https://github.com/parallax/jsPDF) â€” PDF generation
- - [PDF.js](https://mozilla.github.io/pdf.js/) â€” PDF attachment rendering
- - [html2canvas](https://html2canvas.hertzen.com/) â€” For complex exports
+ **Dependencies** (CDN):
+ - JSZip â€” ZIP extraction
+ - jsPDF â€” PDF generation
+ - PDF.js â€” PDF rendering
+ - html2canvas â€” Complex exports
  
- ### Browser Support
- - Chrome 80+
- - Firefox 75+
- - Safari 13+
- - Edge 80+
+ **Browser Support**: Chrome 80+, Firefox 75+, Safari 13+, Edge 80+
  
- ### Privacy Architecture
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”

- ## ğŸ¤ Contributing
- 
- Contributions are welcome! Please feel free to submit a Pull Request.

- 2. Create your feature branch (&#96;git checkout -b feature/AmazingFeature&#96;)

- 
- ## âš ï¸ Known Limitations (WhatsApp Export)
+ ## Known Limitations
  
- These are limitations of WhatsApp's export format, not this tool:
- - **Reply context**: WhatsApp doesn't include reply indicators in exports
- - **Image captions**: Captions added to images are not exported
- - **Message edits**: No indication if messages were edited
- - **Deleted messages**: Messages deleted before export are not included
- 
- ---
- 
- **Made with â¤ï¸ for privacy-conscious users**
- 
- *Your data stays with you. Always.*
+ These are WhatsApp export format limitations:
+ - Reply context not included
+ - Image captions not exported
+ - Message edits not indicated
+ - Deleted messages not included
+ 
+ ## License
+ 
+ MIT License â€” see [LICENSE](LICENSE) file for details.

## Changes Made

### HTML (`index.html`)
- Simplified tagline: "Convert chats to PDF. Private. Offline."
- Reduced dropzone text
- Removed verbose privacy section heading; simplified descriptions
- Condensed "How to Export" instructions
- Changed "Chat Info" â†’ "Options"
- Simplified export button labels ("Export PDF" instead of "Export as PDF")
- Shortened sidebar labels and hints
- Removed emoji from limitations section
- Simplified search placeholder and button labels

### CSS (`styles.css`)
- Removed unused privacy-proof heading styles
- Adjusted spacing for cleaner layout

### README (`README.md`)
- Removed excessive emojis
- Made text concise and professional
- Simplified structure and removed verbose explanations
- Improved scannability

### Meta Tags
- Simplified titles and descriptions for better SEO

The project now follows a minimal, professional style aligned with Apple/Google design principlesâ€”clear, concise, and focused on essential information without unnecessary text.

---


Updated voice call message styling:

1. **Removed low opacity** â€” changed from `opacity: 0.7` to full opacity
2. **Set color to orange** â€” using `#f97316` for both the icon and text
3. **Removed duplicate emoji** â€” removed the ğŸ“ emoji since CSS already provides an icon via `::before`

Voice call messages now display with an orange icon and orange text instead of the faded appearance. The CSS `::before` pseudo-element creates the phone icon, and both the icon and text are styled in orange.

---
